article.title: Model-independent partial wave analysis using a massively-parallel fitting framework

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the magenta line in the Figure 1 plots represent?
choices: The total fit to the data
The contribution from the Ï† resonance
The S-wave amplitude determined from the MIPWA

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the different colors of the data points in Figure 2 represent?
choices: Different values of the K+K- mass squared
Different grid spacings used for the Dalitz plot normalization
Different signal purities of the generated toy MC samples
Different CPU platforms used to perform the MIPWA fit

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Table 1, which GPU platform achieves the shortest runtime for the MIPWA fit?
choices: Laptop ASUS N56V with GeForce GT 650M

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main conclusion that can be drawn from Figure 3?
choices: The MIPWA fit runtime scales linearly with the number of OpenMP threads up to the number of physical cores.
Using a larger number of OpenMP threads always results in faster runtime for the MIPWA fit.
The Goofy CPU platform consistently outperforms the Cerberus platform for the MIPWA fit.
The speedup achieved by using multiple OpenMP threads is negligible.
